article.headline: BOJ upgrades view of economy in eight regions
article.body: TOKYO--The Bank of Japan upgraded its view on the economy in eight of the country's nine regions on Thursday but said the recovery from the coronavirus pandemic is proceeding slowly. In its quarterly Sakura Report, Japan's equivalent of the Federal Reserve's Beige Book, the BOJ said only the island of Shikoku has yet to begin a recovery from the sharp slowdown earlier this year. It said the economy in the Tokyo area "has started to pick up" but remains "in a severe situation." It used similar language for most of Japan's other regions. In a speech to BOJ branch managers earlier Thursday, Gov. Haruhiko Kuroda said he expected the recovery to continue, supported by pent-up demand and the government's economic stimulus policies.
